answerText: Joe Turner's Come and Gone[10] This African-American playwright of Joe Turner's Come and Gone included the plays Ma Rainey's Black Bottom and Fences in his "Pittsburgh Cycle."
heading: MUT |2012 | 1 | 10 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: It is primarily set in a boarding house run by Seth and Bertha Holly, in which Herald has a vision in which he sees an ocean littered with the bones of his ancestors and eventually forsakes Christianity.  [10] Identify this member of the Pittsburgh Cycle that precedes Ma Rainey's Black Bottom. The title figure does not appear in the play, but represents the Southern white man who illegally kidnapped freed slaves.
